## Introduction

- This slide deck summarizes an analysis of World Development Indicators (2022).
- Data source: World Bank @worldbank
- Prior work links economic development and life expectancy @preston1975

---

## Indicators Used

- GDP per capita (`gdp_per_capita`)
- Life expectancy (`life_expectancy`)
- Unemployment rate (`unemployment_rate`)

---

## Load Data

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("data/wdi.csv")
df.head()
```

---

## GDP vs Life Expectancy

```{python}
#| label: fig-gdp-life-slides
#| fig-cap: "GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy (2022)"
#| fig-pos: H

plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("GDP vs Life Expectancy (2022)")
plt.show()
```

**Takeaway:** Higher GDP per capita is generally associated with higher life expectancy.

---

## Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita

```{python}
#| label: fig-top-gdp-slides
#| fig-cap: "Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita (2022)"
#| fig-pos: H

top = df.sort_values("gdp_per_capita", ascending=False).head(10)

plt.barh(top["country"], top["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Country")
plt.title("Top 10 GDP per Capita (2022)")
plt.gca().invert_yaxis()
plt.show()
```

**Takeaway:** GDP per capita varies substantially across countries.

---

## Unemployment Rate Distribution

```{python}
#| label: fig-unemp-slides
#| fig-cap: "Distribution of Unemployment Rates Across Countries (2022)"
#| fig-pos: H

plt.hist(df["unemployment_rate"].dropna(), bins=30)
plt.xlabel("Unemployment rate (%)")
plt.ylabel("Number of countries")
plt.title("Unemployment Rate Distribution (2022)")
plt.show()
```

**Takeaway:** Unemployment rates show wide variation across countries.

---

## Summary Statistics

```{python}
#| label: tbl-summary-slides
#| tbl-cap: "Summary Statistics for GDP per Capita and Life Expectancy (2022)"

df[["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy"]].describe().round(2)
```

---

## Key Findings

- Higher GDP per capita is associated with longer life expectancy
- There is significant variation in GDP per capita across countries
- Unemployment rates vary widely across countries in 2022
- Economic development strongly influences health outcomes

---

## Conclusion

This analysis demonstrates clear relationships between economic and health indicators using 2022 WDI data.
